bestBHT.bht: The evil that emerges from the heart takes shape in the form of reasonings or considerations about certain actions. It encompasses desires for more, various forms of wickedness, deceit, and even lasciviousness. This grim catalog of sins highlights the deeply corrupt nature of the heart. All good and evil, whether in the body or in human nature, stem from the soul and spill over into actions. Therefore, to address the root of these sins and bring about true transformation, the soul must be healed and purified.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: The first shape which the evil that is in the heart takes, when it begins actively to stir, is that of 'considerations' or 'reasonings' on certain suggested actions.

covetousnesses'—or desires after more; 'wickednesses'—here meaning, perhaps, malignities of various forms; 'deceit, lasciviousness'—meaning, excess or enormity of any kind, though by later writers restricted to lewdness.
How appalling is this black catalogue!
Marvin Vincent: For all good and evil, whether in the body or in human nature, originates, as he declared, in the soul, and overflows from thence, as from the head into the eyes; and therefore, if the head and body are to be well, you must begin by curing the soul. That is the first thing.
Thoughts [διαλογισμοι]. Lit., reasonings (compare Mark 9:33, Rev.), or disputings (Philippians 2:14), like the captious questioning of the Pharisees about washing hands.
John Calvin: Out of the heart of man proceeds all that is sinful and that corrupts by its pollution.
All sins proceed from the wicked and corrupt affections of the heart.
An unholy heart pollutes the eyes by making them the ministers, or organs, of wicked desires.
Philip Schaff: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, i.e., reasonings, purposes, not mere notions.
The criminality of acts proceeds from the purpose; for these acts man is responsible.
The plural form indicates that these sins are common and notorious.
John Gill: The thoughts of sin are evil, are to be hated, forsaken, and for which men are accountable to God.
[These include] all wicked imaginations, carnal reasonings, lustful desires, and malicious contrivances.
An evil eye; of envy and covetousness.
John Wesley: First evil thoughts — then murders - and the rest.
Railings — The Greek word includes all reviling, backbiting, and evil speaking.

bhtAttempts.bht: The verse reveals the insidious nature of the evil that resides in the heart. It begins with subtle considerations or reasonings on certain actions, which can lead to an insatiable desire for more, various forms of wickedness, deceit, and even lasciviousness. The darkness of this catalogue is truly horrifying. However, it is essential to recognize that all good and evil originate in the soul. Therefore, in order to bring healing and restoration, one must first address the state of the soul. This verse not only exposes the corrupt origin of sin but also emphasizes the necessity of purifying the heart to safeguard against its devastating consequences.

The evil that emerges from the heart takes shape in the form of reasonings or considerations about certain actions. It encompasses desires for more, various forms of wickedness, deceit, and even lasciviousness. This grim catalog of sins highlights the deeply corrupt nature of the heart. All good and evil, whether in the body or in human nature, stem from the soul and spill over into actions. Therefore, to address the root of these sins and bring about true transformation, the soul must be healed and purified.

Evil takes its initial form in the heart as reasonings or considerations, leading to desires for more, various forms of wickedness, deceit, and lasciviousness. This disturbing list serves as a stark reminder of the depth of darkness that resides within. It is crucial to acknowledge that all good and evil stem from the soul, necessitating the prioritization of soul healing for overall well-being. The origin of sin lies in the innermost being, highlighting the need for a transformation at the deepest level.

Evil begins its activity by manifesting as reasonings and considerations in the heart. This leads to desires for more, various forms of wickedness, deceit, and lasciviousness. The weight of this distressing list is undeniable. However, it reinforces the understanding that all good and evil originate in the soul, spilling over into actions. True healing and restoration require addressing the core of the soul. Therefore, the eradication of these sins necessitates a transformation from within, an essential step towards purity and righteousness.

At the heart of humanity reside the beginnings of evil—the stirring of reasonings and considerations on certain actions. From this starting point, desires for more, wickedness, deceit, and lasciviousness spring forth. The catalogue of sins is both appalling and extensive. It serves as a sobering reminder that all good and evil originate in the soul, influencing the body and nature. To truly address these sins, one must first attend to the healing of the soul, recognizing its pivotal role in shaping thoughts and actions.
